title: Soroban Center or Online App? I Compared Both – Here's My Take
description: Local soroban centers vs online apps: which is better for your child? After trying both, here's what I found.
imageAlt: Comparing soroban center vs online app

content.intro: When I decided to try soroban for my daughter, I found two options: local learning centers and online apps. The price difference was huge. I tried both to see if the center was worth the extra cost.

sections.text: I enrolled my daughter in a local abacus learning center. Here's what it involved:
What I Liked About the Center

items: In-person teacher could correct technique immediately
Social aspect – my daughter liked the other kids
**Homework battles:** More paper worksheets to argue about
**Inflexibility:** Miss a class, miss a lesson

sections.text: We tried an online soroban app during the free trial while still at the center. Here's what that looked like:

items: **Instant feedback:** Know immediately if answer is right

sections.text: After 3 months at the center and 1 month on the app simultaneously, I made a choice: we quit the center.
My daughter made more progress in 1 month on the app (daily practice, instant feedback) than 3 months at the center (weekly classes, delayed feedback). And we saved $168/month.
When a Center Might Be Better

items: Your child needs in-person interaction to stay engaged
You want the social aspect of group learning
Technique correction from a human matters to you
Your schedule accommodates fixed class times

sections.text: When an App Might Be Better

items: Daily practice matters more than weekly deep-dives
Your child is self-motivated or motivated by games/rewards
You want to track progress without asking the teacher

faq.question: Can my child switch from center to app (or vice versa)?
faq.answer: Yes. The skills transfer. Many families start at a center for technique, then continue with an app for convenience.

faq.question: Is the app "as good as" a teacher?
faq.answer: For most kids, yes. The app provides instant feedback that teachers can't match. Good apps also include video demonstrations for technique.

faq.question: What about socialization?
faq.answer: That's the biggest loss. If social learning matters to your child, consider a center. Or do app + extracurricular activities elsewhere.
